jcr:content.jcr:title: Regius Professor of Engineering, Cambridge University

contentheadline.headline: Regius Professor of Engineering, Cambridge University

contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=April 2013}} The '''Regius Professorship of Engineering''' is a [[List of Professorships at the University of Cambridge|professorship]] at the [[University of Cambridge]]. Founded in 1875 as a chair in "Mechanism and Applied Mechanics", it was renamed to "Mechanical Sciences" in 1934, and to "Engineering" in 1966. The chair was bestowed the honorary title of [[Regius Professor]]ship by [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]] in 2011, to mark the end of the [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|Duke of Edinburgh]]'s 34-year tenure as [[List of Chancellors of the University of Cambridge|Chancellor]] of the University.<ref name="MacKay">{{Cite web |url=http://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/david-mackay-appointed-regius-professor-of-engineering |title=David MacKay appointed Regius Professor of Engineering |publisher=University of Cambridge |date=28 March 2013 |accessdate=3 April 2013}}</ref> == Professors of Mechanism and Applied Mechanics == * [[James Stuart (politician)|James Stuart]] (1875) * [[James Alfred Ewing]] (1890) * [[Bertram Hopkinson]] (1903) * [[Charles Edward Inglis]] (1919) * [[John Fleetwood Baker]] (1943) == Professors of Engineering == * [[Arnold Beck|Arnold Hugh William Beck]] (1966–1970) * [[Peter McGregor Ross]] (1970–1974) * [[David Edward Newland]] (1976–2003) * [[Daniel Mark Wolpert]] (2005–2013) * [[David J. C. MacKay]] (2013–present)<ref name="MacKay"/> == References == <references/> {{DEFAULTSORT:Professor Of Engineering, Cambridge University}} [[Category:Professorships at the University of Cambridge|Engineering]] [[Category:Professorships in engineering]] [[Category:1875 establishments in England]]
